description: Borrowed from Ojibwe wiindigoo, from Proto-Algonquian *wi·nteko·wa (“owl; malevolent spirit, cannibalistic monster”). Compare Cree wihtikow, ᐃᐧᐦᑎᑯᐤ (iyhtikow, “greedy person; cannibal; giant man-eating monster”).

nouns.description: wendigo (plural wendigo or wendigos or wendigoes)

entries.meaning: (mythology) A malevolent and violent cannibal spirit found in Anishinaabe, Ojibwe, and Cree mythology, which is said to inhabit the body of a living person and possess him or her to commit murder.
examples: Synonyms: wetiko, wihtikow, witigo, (derived from Cree) witiko

entries.meaning: Synonym of splake (“kind of hybrid fish”)
